Description: Plastic box containing 'papyrus fragments too small to mount, June 1996', from a papyrus (twelve fragments); Hieratic text, restored in 1996 by B Leach from fragments extracted from cartonnage before 1907. The text is a description of plants in a list with the heading 'Seeing all plants of marsh and field (?) ...'
Curator's comments: Quirke in Davies, Colour and Painting, London 2001, 190-1, pl. 6 [1]. Photographs given to N. Baum for study (by S. Quirke?): to be published by her and F. Herbin (confirmed Feb. 2020).
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (57262) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/57262)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: loss, displaced fragments Black ink Red ink Displayed in Room 61 from 2001 until 2007 Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: self adhesive tape Object Priority: A Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: A
